result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on November 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with GN, PN, SN, ZN, or JN. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with JMN except only as necessary for family court proceedings. 
- Defendant shall not be within two blocks of the the 3800 block of Hoover Dr. except Defendant can drive on E. Washington Ave but may not stop anywhere on E Washington Ave between Thayer Rd and HWY 51/Stoughton Rd except at stop signs/stop lights.
- Defendant shall not be at Woodman's on Milwaukee Street in Madison.
- Defendant shall not be at any City of Madison Parks. 
- Defendant shall not be at Costco in Sun Prairie. 
- Defendant shall surrender their passport to the Dane County Clerk of Court. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 11

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

Defendant Dexter P Newallo in court.  Attorney Kim Marie Zion in court for Dexter P Newallo.  Attorney Trisha L Simmons in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties request PTC.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Dexter P Newallo in court.  Attorney Kim Marie Zion in court for Dexter P Newallo.  Attorney Trisha L Simmons in court for State of Wisconsin. Victims' MO JN by phone. DE's motion to amend bond. Argument. State objects to any amendment of bond. Statement by JN. Court amends cash bond to $1500. Court amends condition of Defendant shall not be at Woodman's East in Madison to Defendant shall not be at Woodmans on Milwaukee St in Madison, WI. Court adds condition: Defendant shall not be at any City of Madison parks. Court amends condition: Defendant shall not be within two blocks of the the 3800 block of Hoover Dr. to Defendant shall not be within two blocks of the the 3800 block of Hoover Dr. except Defendant can drive on E Washington Ave but may not stop anywhere on E Washington Ave between Thayer Rd and HWY 51/Stoughton Rd except at stop signs/stop lights. Court removes condition: Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior approval of the Court. ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN THE SAME.
